short_summary: Demolition of the Murray Building interior in 3 levels
description: The project involves interior demolition on 3 levels of the Murray Building on the Bedford Institute of Oceanography campus for a future full renovation.  There is asbestos in certain areas and a Hazardous Material Report will be provided as part of the tender package.  The building is connected to the campus but is vacant. ================

**Murray Building Interior Demolition Tender Notice**

**Reference Number:** WS4253892965-Doc4253957254
**Amendment Number:** 1
**Solicitation Number:** WS4253892965
**Publication Date:** October 11, 2023
**Tender Closing Date:** October 27, 2023, at 14:00:00

**Project Overview:**
The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) is seeking a contractor to undertake interior demolition work on three levels of the Murray Building on the Bedford Institute of Oceanography campus. The project is a precursor to a full renovation and involves the removal of asbestos in certain areas. A Hazardous Materials Report will be provided to the successful bidder as part of the tender package.

**Key Project Details:**

* Location: Murray Building, Bedford Institute of Oceanography campus
* Scope of work: Interior demolition on three levels
* Asbestos removal: Present in certain areas
* Hazardous Materials Report: Provided as part of tender package
* Building access: Connected to campus, but vacant
* Utility services: Heat and electricity to remain in service during project duration

**Tender Requirements:**

* Contract Method: Competitive Open Bidding
* Selection Criteria: Lowest Price
* Trade Agreements: Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
* Regions of Opportunity: None
* Regions of Delivery: Nova Scotia
* Contracting Entity: Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
* Bid Submission: In person or via electronic bid

**Contact Information:**

* Name: Richard Parsons (SPAC/PSPC)
* Email: richard.parsons@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca
* URL: https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/17690592?extsite=MTc2OTA1OTJfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==

Note to Bidder
---------------

It is the bidder's responsibility to ensure they have all necessary information and documentation prior to submitting their bid. The PSPC reserves the right to modify or reject any bid. All bid submissions must be complete and accompanied by a valid bid form. Failure to meet these requirements may result in the bid being rejected. The PSPC is not responsible for any errors or omissions in the bid submission process.
